metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000246 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - negligible
metadata.description:
Python package pysaml2 version 4.4.0 and earlier reuses the initializationvector across encryptions in the IDP server, resulting in weak encryptionof data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000246` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pysaml2 - 4.5.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-pysaml2 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu2').
